msItem.title: Eiríks saga rauða
Þorfinns saga karlsefnis
msItem.incipit: Olafur heet konungur er kallaþur var Oleyfur hvyte
msItem.finalRubric: og endar hier so sauguna af Eireke hinum rauda
msItem.note: Running titles on some pages have been cropped

msItem.title: On Iceland and Greenland
msItem.rubric: Annal um Jsland og Grænland, ur fornum bökum skrifad
msItem.incipit: Jsland liggur so nordarlega under zodiaco
msItem.explicit: hielldu þeir þadann burt til Halogalands.
msItem.note: Contains sections on the discovery of Iceland from Norway, Geirmundr heljarskin, Eiríkr hin rauða, Þórbjörn (i.e. Þorfinnr) karlsefni and various annalistic information.

msItem.title: On the Danish Attacks on Algiers in 1770 and 1772-73
msItem.rubric: Faa ord afskrift yfer stadenn Algier sem sa Danske flote aarenn 1770, 1772 og 1773 bombarderade.
msItem.incipit: Siøvikinga bæled Algier, sem um alla Europam
msItem.explicit: af þeim Danska flota fullkomega dregenn til hliden, og hlaut ad accordera fridenn.

msItem.title: Poem on the Danish Attacks on Algiers in 1770 and 1772-73
msItem.rubric: Þær Dónsku vysur er þessare description med filgdu, skrifast hier hia paraphrastice verteradar
msItem.note: A Danish poem with an accompanying Icelandic translation.

msItem.title: Ljósvetninga saga
Reykdæla saga
msItem.explicit: og spir ef hann vill nockud leggia til böta,

msItem.title: Description of churches in Greenland
msItem.incipit: Su Austarsta bygd i Grænlande, liggur rett Austur under Heriölfsnese, og nefnest Skagafiórdr,
msItem.explicit: þar Vex og þad besta hveite sem nockur stadar kann finnast.
msItem.note: Statement of responsibility on fol. 87v: giórd af Ivare Bere, sem synest ad hafa vered þar umbodsmadur i þvi 14da seculo. þrickt i Dónsku Anno 1732. Enn a Jslendsku skrifud Anno 1759

msItem.title: On the Turkish abductions on the Westman Islands in 1627
msItem.rubric: Um þaug sorglegu hrigdartydende, sem skiedu og tilfiellu j Vestmannaeium, fra þeim xvii deige July, til þess xixda a þessu äre Anno 1627 af mordlegre umgeingne þeirra aumu bloodhunda sem af Tyrkiansvallde sender voru.
msItem.incipit: Hvórnenn þeirra ferdalags uppbiriun first skede
msItem.explicit: og þackar giórd hier stundlegu enn annars heims eilyflega Amen

msItem.title: Letter discussing the 1627 raids by Þorleifur Magnússon
msItem.rubric: Þetta er skrifad epter brefe Þorleifs Magnussonar skrifad Anno 1627 þann 17 Augustum
msItem.incipit: Þa ogudlegu mordingia er j Austfiórdu komu
msItem.explicit: ef hann vill landenu bijhallda under krununa

msItem.title: Letter concerning pirate raids by Bishop Oddur Einarsson
msItem.rubric: Af brefe biskupsens Hl. Odds Einarssonar
msItem.explicit: Gud sie oss aullum nädugur firer sinn kiæra son voru herra Jesum Christum Amen

msItem.title: Hervarar saga og Heiðreks (Extracts)
Gestspeki Gestumblinda
Gátur Gests blinda
msItem.rubric: Gestspeke edur gaatur Gests hins Blinda med raadningum Heidreks kongs
msItem.incipit: Gestur Bilnde mællte, hafa villda eg þad i giær hafda
msItem.explicit: tőku þeir sig saman 9 eirn dag og drpu hann Ender
msItem.note: Contains riddles from the saga with a brief prose ending. The riddle order matches the R redaction as in GKS 2845 4to.

msItem.title: Jóns saga helga
Jóns saga Ögmundarsonar
msItem.incipit: Hier hefium vier saugu eda fräsøgu frä hinum Herre Jöne biskupe
msItem.explicit: Enn epter domsdag himnarykes Vist Eilyfa med sialfum sier og ollum Helgum In Secula Seculorum Amen.
msItem.note: Contains the eldest version of the saga. Cf. Kålund 1889, II:519.

msItem.title: Heiðarvíga saga
Víga-Styrs saga
msItem.rubric: Inntak af Vyga Styrs sógu fragmente
msItem.incipit: Atle stód i dyrum ute og var hann veigenn
msItem.explicit: þa Harekssyner urdu hans varer j bænum leitudu þeir hans,
msItem.note: Note on fol. 139r: Nota M:M: merker minner mig og er eg ej viss um S:S: seiger sagann eru sogunnar eigenn ord.
A signature (autograph?) at the head of fol. 139r: Jóns Ólafssonar Grunnvíkings. Contains a section of the saga destroyed in the 1728 Copenhagen fire but recalled from memory by Jón Ólafsson.
Explicit followed by pen tests: hans hans (hermantar !)

msItem.title: Flóamanna saga
Þorgils saga Örrabeinsfóstra
msItem.rubric: Flooa-Manna saga, af Þorgils Orrabeins fostra
msItem.incipit: Haralldr Gullskeggu hefur kongur heitid i Sogni
msItem.explicit: og endar her so Flóamanna augu.

msItem.title: Fertrams saga ok Platós
msItem.incipit: hertoga son var þar mestr, hvór kongs syni geck
msItem.explicit: og endast her þessi saga af þeim brædrum Fertram og Plato.
msItem.note: Text lacks part of the first chapter.

msItem.title: Illuga saga Gríðarfóstra
msItem.rubric: Søgu þaattur af Jlluga Grýdar fóstra.
msItem.incipit: Sá kongur ried fyrir Danmørk, er Hríngur hiet
msItem.explicit: og lúkum vér so sógu þættinum af Jllhuga Grídar fóstra.

msItem.title: Hálfdanar þáttur svarta
Hálfdanar þáttr svarta
Hálfdanar þáttur svarta ok Haralds hárfagra
msItem.rubric: Þaattur af Halfdani Kongi svarta fødur Harallds ens hárfagra
msItem.incipit: Halfdan hefur kóngur heitid, og kalladur hinn svarti
msItem.explicit: og endum vier so þennann sógu þátt med svo ordnu nidurlagi sem sagt er.

support.note: Contains one flyleaf of printed waste at the front and two flyleaves at the back of the volume.

foliation.p: Foliated in pencil in the lower, outer corners of every tenth page, and at the beginning and end of most items. Fols. 90v, 156, 182v and 183 are blank.

supportDesc.condition: Some leaves lightly stained, but in overall good condition

layout.note: Poems on fols. 27v-28v written in two columns. Running titles on fols. 1v-18r and 29v-87r.

decoDesc.decoNote: Floriated initials with some green coloring on fol. 107r

additions.p: A table of contents has been added to the recto of the front flyleaf. Notes at the end of several texts.

binding.p: Bound in a re-used eighteenth-century dark brown leather binding with blind-stamped decorations (flowers) and metal (bronze?) clasps with leather straps. The metal portion of the upper clasp is lacking. The front and back flyleaves contain printed waste from a Danish Folketallet (census) for the first of February 1801.

origin.note: Dated 1800 on fol. 182r, but the variety of hands suggests that the manuscript was composed over a period of time. According to Foote ( Jóns saga Hólabyskups ens helga,p. 114), the part containing Jóns saga helga (fols. 107-133) was written before 1735.

provenance.p: A note in the middle of the table of contents on the front flyleaf reads: Keyptar med Verdi i Holti i Ønundarfirdi þann 17da Augusti 1811 af Þorvalldi Bỏdvarssynz. A signature (ownership mark?) has been excised from the first rear flyleaf, which also contains a pen test reading: Gudmug

revisionDesc.change: Created as subset of full file on handrit.is.
Introduced repository auth file. Updated repository element pointing, adding @ref and removing @key.
Inserted origDate and origPlace elements based on previous data, now removed.
Extracted pagination and page dimension data from previous version.
Extracted layout data from previous version.
Supplied information from Kålund and Handrit catalogues.
